name: Uganda
takeaway: After a slump in the amount and intensity of exchanges, particularly people-to-people exchanges, due to the COVID-19 pandemic, there's been a fast uptake in trips to China, training courses, and scholarships. This is quite noticeable in the Domains of Academia and Domestic Politics.

In the area of media and telecommunications, state-owned and CCP-connected entities enjoy a very comfortable position in the market, covering a range of sectors, from entertaintment, to news to mobile communications. This has been the case for almost a decade now.

The PRC enjoys widespread support among the political and economic elites connected to the status quo in Uganda and this translated in a generally positive view of the general public towards China, as as indicated by public opinions polls. There are very few public cases of anti-Chinese sentiment voiced either through the press or in political life.
description-1: In 2023, Uganda had a GDP per capita of US$1,014 and a total population of 47.98 million people.
description-2: Uganda established full diplomatic relations with the People's Republic of China in 1962. Uganda was ranked 128th in Reporters Without Borders‘ 2024 World Press Freedom Index, and rated Not Free in Freedom House‘s 2024 Global Freedom Index, with a score of 34/100.

Media.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: There is no evidence of any Ugandan media organisation belonging to these network, but it cannot be ruled out that there might be some that do belong. Therefore, this question is skipped.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: There seems to be a fair number of cases of Ugandan journalists visiting China at the expense of PRC-connected entities. While there was a pause of these types of trips because of COVID-19, there's evidence of these trips having restarted in recent months.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: A good number of journalists visiting China do so to attend training. One such example, are trainings organised by the China Publica Diplomacy Association (CPDA) like "China International Press Communication Center". While these are presented as "exchanges", they moslty involved foreign journalists visiting China, rather than Chinese journalists visiting other countries.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: PRC state media are available in English and Swahili, both of which are official languages in Uganda. CGTN Africa is available on some satellite platforms and digital terrestrial TV (and also online). CRI has an FM radio station in Kampala and in Zinga, and broadcasts in both English and Swahili. Xinhua and People's Daily publish content in Swahili online as well.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: Many news outlets in Uganda carry content produced by PRC state-funded media, particulalry Xinhua. There's only long running and ongoing collaboration between CGTN and Uganda's national broadcaster UBC.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: There's no public evidence of this, but there might have been cases where journalists have been pressured to retract stories, but this isn't evidenced.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: It is common for Uganda-China relations to be referred to in terms of friendship and in connection to a long standing history of Chinese support to Uganda. Some of this content is produced by PRC affiliated media. There's also examples of local commentators using this language.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: There are some instances of commentary an opinion pieces that repeat PRC-favored narratives, even though issues such as human rights in Xinjiang or pro-democracy protests in Hong Kong were not very prevalent in news coverage.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: There have been a number of visits and contacts between the Parliament of Uganda and the PRC counterpart. In November 2023, the Deputy Speaker of the Parliament of Uganda noted than an MP had been assigned to head a "Uganda-China Parliamentary Friendship Group"
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: Uganda receives aid from China in a range of domains, including health, infrastructrure and others. That said, Western donors remain, for the most part, the main source of foreign aid into the country.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: There's evidence that training for Uganda diplomats has taken place in recent years, although the number of training opportunities might have been reduced in the post-COVID period.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: There's evidence of Ugandan politicians and government officials participating in events by CCICED. Also, in 2021, Uganda hosted one event linked to the group.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: China-Uganda relations enjoy the second highest level, "comprehensive strategic partnership" status.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: A range of Ugandan of elected officials has repeatedly expressed their support to the PRC's own "one China principle".
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: In a 2016 interview with Xinhua, Uganda's Foreign Minister is quoted as supporting China's position on the South China Sea. Therefore, Uganda has adhered to the PRC’s territorial claim and the Indicator warrants a 4 score.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: The Ugandan government has voted alongside China in different multilateral fora on issues related to Xinjiang. Ugandan officials have also been quoted in PRC affiliated media as supporting China's "justified stance on Xinjiang-related topics". In light of this, it can be said that Uganda has adhered to the PRC’s treatment of Uyghur's in Xinjiang.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: In 2021, Uganda was a signatory with 60+ other countries of a joint statement at the UN in Geneva in which it  showed support of China's position on Tibet-related matters, thus warranting a 4 score for this indicator.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: In 2019, the Ugandan government released a letter of support of China in its handling of pro-democracy protests in Hong Kong. Therefore, a score of 4 is justified for this indicator.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: In June 2023, Makerere University and Huawei signed an agreement to establish and ICT Academy at the university. In announcing the detail, Huawei representatives said that similar agreements might happen across the country.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: There's only one Confucius Instittute in Uganda based at Makerere University, which is regarded as the university in the country. There's also a Confucius Classroom at Luyanzi Institute of Technology.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: According to reports by Xinhua, Uganda's ministry of education "has included Chinese language learning in the lower secondary school curriculum. Some secondary schools in the country are already teaching their students the Chinese language."
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.
Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: There's an essay writing competition running in New Vision, which is one of the main newspapers in the country, that is organised in cooperation with the Chinese Embassy. This competition is known as "My China Story Essay Competition".
Academia.note: There's evidence of Ugandans participating in these programs, but not in recent years.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: PRC has offered scholarships to Ugandan scholars especially at Makerere University. On 26th July 2022, it was reported on Makerere Website that 24 scholarships had been offered by the Chinese embassy.
Academia.note: There's evidence of such trips, but not in the period under research.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: In Uganda, there's only one university degree in Chinese and Asian studies in the country, but there's no indication that PRC-connected entiites in the design of the curriculum, even though it is a possibilty given that a Confucius Institue is present at Makerere University where the BA is taught. Confucius Institute teachers have been involved in developing local Chinese language teaching materials.

Domestic Politics.evidence: China Railway 18 Bureau Group Co Ltd, has agreed with Kitgum Municipal Council to undertake the construction of 2.89 kms of roads funded by the World Bank.
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Domestic Politics.evidence: Entebbe and Changsha are sister-city with ties, respectively in Uganda and China. The two minicipalities recently held a business conference in Entebbe, organised with the aim of bolstering bilateral co-operation between Uganda and China, specifically the sister-sister relations of the respective cities. Jinja has also twined with Shenyang, capital of China’s northeast Liaoning province.
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Domestic Politics.evidence: Among many others, Kitgum Municipality, for instance, has sent people from the political wing to the PRC. However, details of such trips have been kept confidential and out of the public domain.
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Domestic Politics.evidence: The delegation was led by Mr. Li Mingxiang, the Vice Minister for the International Department of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China (IDCPC). A group of ruling National Resistance Movement (NRM) party leaders welcomed a high-powered delegation from the Communist Party of China this evening, following their arrival at Entebbe International Airport.
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Domestic Politics.evidence: Uganda's National Resistance Movement (NRM)- the ruling party leaders have, from time to time visited China, under the invitation of the CCP. Also, CCP leaders jabe visited Uganda at the invitation of the NRM

Domestic Politics.evidence: Though, it should be noted that Uganda's former foreign minister, Sam Kutesa has been acused of taking a $500,000 bribe to secure a luicratic deal for a Chinese oil firm.

Domestic Politics.evidence: The COSASE leader has recieved death threats from government officials over probing government parastatals, some involving China's investments.He led the committee that investigated several projects including the Airport expansion project, Isimba dam project, among others, backed by China.

Economy.evidence: China is not Uganda's leading trading partner, the UAE is.

Economy.evidence: Through Exim bank, China owns 75% of Uganda's bitlateral sovereign debt. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Yes" response.

Economy.evidence: UAE is Uganda's top customer of Ugandas extractive industry.

Society.evidence: China's StarTimes the largest Pay-TV operator in Uganda. Its the cheapest and most accessible. StarTimes also offers the hardware to distribute satellite and cable content. The StarTimes platform has many many Chinese shows, includig soap operas. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Significant" rating.

Military.evidence: Chinese companies have long been supplying the Uganda People’s Defence Forces (UPDF) with military/law enforcement equipment.
Military.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Military.evidence: Uganda sent officials to the third China-Africa Peace and Security Forum taking place in Beijing. On the sidelines of the forum, State Councilor and Minister of National Defense Li Shangfu met with security and defense leaders from the African Union and 10 African countries, including Uganda.
Military.note: Gen. Muhoozi, President Museveni's son has visited China several times and so have other top UPDF leaders. In 1995, Gen. Muhoozi visited Hunan, Chairman Mao's birth place and in 1995, he joined the army. More here https://www.independent.co.ug/how-china-shapes-ugandas-generals/
Military.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Military.evidence: Uganda signed agreements for the creation of national security communication systems. This system is reported to be used by the police, army, and intelligence agencies in Uganda.

Military.evidence: China has provided humanitarian relief to Uganda (and many other African countries) to help them deal with the Covid-19 pandemic, but it is unclear whether the PLA was involved. At the time, China sent aid to Uganda. Besides the donation of protective gear, medicines and equipment, Uganda received a donation of Sinovac vaccines from the Chinese government.

Military.evidence: To buttress its already vast economic footprint in several African countries, including Uganda, the Chinese government through its army; the People’s Liberation Army (PLA), is constantly engaging army officers in Africa, including through training programs, bilateral meetings, and exchanges with their Chinese counterparts.
